Title: Vector Security: Admin Portal

ImgURLS.name: Edit a dealer through the Dealer Portal

ShortDesc: Contributed to an administration portal for Vector Security while working at Savvior Technology Solutions.
LongDesc:
Contributed to the front-end design and Laravel development of the administrator portal for Vector Security, allowing managers to oversee dealersâ€™ account details. Implemented features that interact with a MySQL database through Doctrine. Coded routines that parse Excel documents to update database entries.

Through this project, I gained my first exposure to Laravel and to working on a large-scale project. I developed stronger PHP, HTML/CSS and database knowledge.

Title: Calgon-Carbon: Mobile App
ShortDesc: Created an Ionic mobile app for Calgon-Carbon during my time as a co-op at Savvior Technology Solutions.
LongDesc: Lead the design and production of the Calgon‑Carbon mobile app during my Savvior Co-op. With little to no prior experience, I taught myself Angular and Ionic Framework using online resources. Created the back-end API for the app with Laravel. Enjoyed the novel experience of developing for mobile devices and creating APIs from scratch. Tackled the challenges of designing front-end layouts in response to various UI constraints.

Title: Personal Website
ShortDesc: Proud pixel pusher and modal lover. Built from scratch with Angular, Angular Material, HTML & CSS.
LongDesc:
Developed this website using Angular and Angular Material within a week. Chose to have a minimalistic and clean layout to display projects efficiently, minimizing the need to constantly switch pages. I'm a big fan of Material Design and I really like using cards to represent information. To generate the cards, I process a JSON file which contains all the information relevant to each card.

Collaborated with a communication design student, Tiffany Jiang, to get feedback and critique on the visual and user experience design.

ShoeIn is the beginning of a platform which enables nonprofit organization donors to see the impact of their donation, while simultaneously measuring the efficacy of the organizations which receive their donations and thereby holding them to a higher degree of accountability. The majority of the front-end web development was done collaboratively between myself and Tiffany Jiang, the designer on the team, starting with a Bootstrap HTML/CSS template. We worked together to translate her mockups and wireframe sketches into the website design.
Video
ShortDesc: ShoeIn is the beginning of a platform which enables nonprofit organization donors to see the impact of their donation first-hand.
Title: ShoeIn: HackGCT Grand Prize Winner
Onigiri
ShortDesc: TO BE ANNOUNCED! An exciting collaboration with acclaimed designer Tiffany Jiang. Being built with Ionic Framework and Flask, backed by a MySQL database.
LongDesc: I am the lead engineer on an upcoming mobile app being built in collaboration with Tiffany Jiang. I am using Ionic Framework for the front-end and Flask to build the backend, along with a MySQL database. We started with a Firebase, but quickly realized it did not have the required functionality for our app. As we move forward, we will be conducting user research to better understand our market and potential users. MVP coming soon.

Title: Hack the Hits 2016
ShortDesc: Over 24 hours, we will be attempting to create a new, expressive musical instrument. Check back to see what we come up with!
LongDesc:
On April 9th, Tiffany Jiang, Ritwik Gupta, and I will be participating in Red Bull's 2016 Hack the Hits hackathon. We will be competing against 6 other teams in San Francisco to build a musical instrument that's fun, expressive, and most importantly useful in a studio or live setting.

This is a new experience for me, as I haven't done much work with hardware. As a musician myself, I'm very excited to participate in a hackathon where I will have the opportunity to learn more about hardware hacking in the context of music.
